meanings.definition: The ability to make good judgments and quick decisions.
meanings.sent1: Her acumen in choosing the right investments led to great success.
meanings.sent2: His acumen in solving problems quickly impressed his colleagues.
meanings.sent3: With her acumen, she could always pick the best movies to watch.
meanings.sent4: His acumen in navigating through challenges was like a sharp sword.
meanings.sent5: The acumen of the detective in solving cases was unmatched.

meanings.sent1: His acumen in understanding people's emotions made him a great counselor.
meanings.sent2: The writer's acumen in capturing human nature in stories was remarkable.
meanings.sent3: The cat showed acumen in finding the hidden treats around the house.
meanings.sent4: Her acumen in predicting the future was like having a crystal ball.
meanings.sent5: The acumen of the scientist in discovering new planets was astounding.

meanings.definition: Sharpness or shrewdness, especially in business matters.
meanings.sent1: His acumen in negotiating deals always resulted in favorable outcomes.
meanings.sent2: The businessman's acumen in spotting opportunities was unmatched.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel showed acumen in finding the best nuts in the forest.
meanings.sent4: Her acumen in outsmarting competitors was like a strategic game.
meanings.sent5: The acumen of the entrepreneur in growing businesses was legendary.
